summary: if a patient presents with a severe respiratory infection, notify your local public health authority/Medical Health Officer. Ensure airborne precautions for aerosol-generating procedures. 143 laboratory-confirmed human cases of avian influenza A (H7N9), including 47 deaths. human-to-human transmission has been observed, but community transmission has not been observed. the reservoir for the virus remains unknown; the MERS-CoV virus has been identified in camels but most cases have not been linked to camel exposure.
